key_definitions.start_frame: Frame index when diver's feet leave the platform/springboard (airborne)
key_definitions.splash_frame: Frame index when diver's body (hands/head) first makes contact with water
key_definitions.end_frame: Frame index when diver's body is fully submerged below water surface
key_definitions.fps: Frames per second (all test fixtures are 30 fps)

metadata.conversion_note: To get elapsed time in seconds: elapsed_time_sec = frame_index / fps. Example: frame 900 at 30fps = 900/30 = 30 seconds
metadata.conversion_tool: Use: diveanalyzer/utils/frame_time_converter.py to validate and convert to seconds
metadata.validation: All frame indices must satisfy: start_frame < splash_frame < end_frame

dives.notes: Single clear dive. Frames 876-914 = 38 frames = 1.27 seconds. Conversion: 876/30=29.2s, 898/30=29.9s, 914/30=30.5s

short_dive.mp4.annotation_notes: FRAME-BASED! With 30 fps, frame 30 = 1s, frame 900 = 30s. Your filled data: frames 876-914 (1.27s duration). Verify this matches expected 1-3s dive duration.

dives.notes: diver behind another one but clear dive visible
diver failed his dive and smacked the water flat
diver over-rotated a bit but good entry
diver executed a clear dive but close to previous one

multi_dive.mp4.annotation_notes: only annotated the 2990 first frames. CRITICAL TEST - 37 audio peaks. Find actual dives visually. Real dives: splash_frame gaps should be 150+ frames apart (150 frames = 5 seconds @ 30fps). Total video = 8991 frames.

dives.notes: diver failed the hurdle once earlier and this may have caused a loud noise and a false positive

noisy_audio.mp4.annotation_notes: annotated only the first 519 frames. Record using FRAME INDICES. Background noise present. Total video = 2679 frames = 89.3 seconds @ 30fps.

edge_cases/back_to_back.mp4.dive_spacing: FILL_ME_IN (should be <150 frames between splashes = <5 seconds)

dives.notes: Should be LESS than 150 frames (~5s) after first splash

edge_cases/back_to_back.mp4.annotation_notes: Two VERY CLOSE dives. Use FRAME INDICES. Gap = dive2_splash_frame - dive1_splash_frame (should be <150). Total = 1799 frames.

dives.notes: Should match frame indices from short_dive.mp4 EXACTLY (same content, audio removed)

edge_cases/no_audio.mp4.annotation_notes: Identical to short_dive.mp4 but NO AUDIO. Use MOTION to find dive. Frame indices should be identical. Total = 1195 frames.

motion_bursts.reason: Person jumped/moved but did not enter water

edge_cases/failed_dive.mp4.annotation_notes: FAILED DIVE: motion occurs but NO SPLASH. Use FRAME INDICES for motion timing. Mark splash_present=false. Total = 1195 frames.

edge_cases/false_positive.mp4.annotation_notes: NO ACTUAL DIVE - Loud noise only, no diver visible. Use FRAME INDEX to mark sound timing. Total = 887 frames = 29.5 seconds @ 30fps.

dives.notes: Very short clip - entire dive in <3 seconds. Total video = only 67 frames!

edge_cases/very_short.mp4.annotation_notes: TINY VIDEO: 2.17 seconds = 67 frames total @ 30fps. Use FRAME INDICES (0-67). Typical dive = 30-90 frames.

dives.notes: Frames 1500-1800 = 300 frames = 10s. Gap from dive1: 1650-450=1200 frames = 40 seconds ✓
Frames 4500-4800 = 300 frames. Gap from dive2: 4650-1650=3000 frames = 100 seconds ✓

example_completed.annotation_notes: EXAMPLE using FRAME INDICES. Validation: start < splash < end ✓, durations 30-90 frames (1-3s) ✓, gaps >150 frames (5s) ✓. Use frame_time_converter.py to convert to seconds and validate.
